title: Noise Pollution and Birth Defects in Humans

content.question: Which of the following best describes why the authors do not claim that noise exposure induces birth defects in humans?

choices.label: There is sufficient evidence that exposure to noise induces some health risks in humans.
There is insufficient evidence to support that noise exposure induces birth defects in humans.
Noise exposure can induce hearing impairment and decreased school performance.
A high-priority study subject is the effect of noise on children.

content.answer: There is insufficient evidence to support that noise exposure induces birth defects in humans.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Describe the author's reasoning (use of evidence to support a claim).
